programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E01 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Julie and James are looking for a new home to raise their two boys. James is in the tech industry and would love an energy efficient home. Julie has her own dance studio and can't wait to get back to work after giving birth to her second son. Eve and Shawn are the perfect team for the job, especially with Timberworx's cutting edge "Net-Zero" project.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Giulia and Scott have recently come into an inheritance and want the house of their dreams. Currently, they live in a modest bungalow in a busy neighbourhood but would prefer to live in a secluded house with a magnificent view. Ideally, Giulia also wants a house that has separate living quarters for her ageing parents.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Kevin is a retired, successful businessman. He is a single dad to Shannon and Jennifer. Shannon has been accepted into the Ontario Veterinarian College at the University of Guelph, which is Canada's leading program in veterinary health care. This is the reason they are moving to Guelph. Kevin is happy to live anywhere as long as it has excellent golf courses. Eve will be glad to tell him that Guelph just happens to have 3 of the top ones in Ontario.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Laura is on the hunt for a new home for long time clients Marino and Paula. The couple and their three kids would like a spacious house with a country feel to escape their hectic lifestyles. Due to Marino's busy schedule as a producer, he would prefer a house that is all-inclusive and turnkey. Their kids are very active want a pool and the option for horse stables. Laura's going to find them the perfect home.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Louise, Jason, and their two children have been living in Europe for the past 10 years, but now they would like to be closer to their family in Canada. Louise absolutely adores the European aesthetic; the sense of luxury conveyed by multi-peaked roof-lines, bay-shaped windows, and decorative stone. She wants a house that allows them the feeling of "living abroad" without leaving the country.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Diogo is a dedicated musician working on his new album. He has been debating between moving to Miami or staying in Canada. Toronto is closer to his family and where he feels at home with his music. Danielle will show him some spectacular properties in both cities and see what he decides.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Elizabeth and Michael are retired and want to move closer to their kids and grandchildren. They want to downsize from their two-story house into a bungalow. Luckily, Eve knows all about luxury bungalows. Elizabeth loves to exercise and really would like a gym. Michael has a passion for cars and needs at least a three-car garage. Their current house is dated so they would love a house that is turnkey. Eve will do her best to find their forever home.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E08 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Tomarra and Rob had just married and blended their two families. As a new family, they want to transition to a quiet neighbourhood away from the hustle and bustle of Toronto. Steve is up for the challenge. Rob is a writer and plans to work from home, while Tomarra is a naturopath who would love to have her own studio. Ultimately, they want to start cherishing the real things in life, and that is spending more time with their kids.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E09 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Darlene and Bruce are in the market for a new home and have enlisted Laura to help them out. Darlene's one request is that they stay close to their current home, where their daughter goes to school. For Bruce, quality construction materials and workmanship are of paramount importance. One thing the entire family agrees on is that the backyard should have a fantastic entertainment space since they spend plenty of time together outdoors and enjoy having guests over.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E10 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Kathryn and Neil are true urbanites. They love what downtown Toronto has to offer. When Neil found out his company was relocating to Guelph, they weren't thrilled. After five months of long commutes, the Thompson family is ready to take the risk and make a move-with some conditions. The new house has to have a pool and playroom for the kids and a large entertainment area for adults. Eve's challenge is to find them an enticing home that will convince their friends from the city to visit.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E11 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Ashley and Ali are ready to take their relationship and living situation to the next level. The young entrepreneurs are prepared to move into a house, but the one thing they can't agree on is where to live. Ashley wants an estate home outside the city that has an outdoor pool and beautifully manicured gardens. Ali, on the other hand, insists on being close to his downtown office and walking distance from restaurants and shops.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E12 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Stephanie is making a big move from BC to Guelph to be closer to her son John and his family. She doesn't want the move to be a hassle and is looking for an accessible, decent-sized home for her grandchildren and visitors from BC. Good sized guest rooms and a large backyard are a must. As she loves to cook, she would also like a new kitchen. Eve will show Stephanie 3 beautiful homes that fit the criteria. Stephanie is going to have a difficult decision.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S03 : E13 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: Steve Bailey, Mike Donia and Daryl King review their favourite homes. Steve takes us down memory lane to his 18th century farmhouse, and another home with a stunning infinity pool. Daryl's listings range from King city to Caloden, with helicopter pads and sprawling backyards. Mike brings us back to his fabulous listings in Thailand. He shows us a home made entirely of Bamboo, and billion-dollar property.

programme.title: Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.sub-title: S04 : E01 Top Million Dollar Agent
programme.desc: George is a retired basket ball player, and Mada is an international model. For a man over 7 feet tall, finding the perfect house might be a challenge. Danielle knows high ceilings come in all shapes and sizes, can she find a style they'll like? They also want a pool and a home theatre.

programme.desc: A testy man is sent to the isolation cell to "cool off." A teary-eyed young man maintains his innocence. An inmate may have ingested contraband to avoid possession charges.

programme.desc: In his holding cell, a man fights officers after taking Xanax. An officer discovers a suspect may be facing criminal charges for his son. K-9 units are needed during a search for improvised weapons.

programme.sub-title: S21 : E04 Settled with a Pipe
programme.desc: A man attacking a woman is tackled by an officer. A vehicle is pulled over for a drug deal in progress. A woman smashes a car window with a pipe in a fit of road rage.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Witnesses of a car burglary assist an officer in locating the suspect. An officer investigates a fight involving a young man and a homeless gentleman. A suspect’s testimony is debunked after an eyewitness confirms that his knife wounds were self-inflicted.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect uses bizarre driving techniques to elude cops. A tough officer wades through a forest of denial before finding the crack. Police search for man accused of shooting up the neighborhood.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man is captured after appearing on an episode of "America's Most Wanted". An Officer detains a man for drug possession. Officers serve a search warrant and find four suspects with narcotics in their home.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspicious man attempts to flee Police on foot and is later arrested for possession. Officers in New Jersey charge a garage owner with receiving stolen property. Officers arrest a man after witnesses report purse snatching.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police use convenience store footage to make an arrest for burglary. Police attempt to help two neighbors reconcile their differences. Officers arrest a woman for domestic violence.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect is arrested after officers find a loaded gun during a routine search. Two men are detained after suspected of battery. Officers arrest a man pick-pocketing during Mardi Gras.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers respond to a domestic dispute call resulting in an indecent arrest. Officers in Tennessee investigate a house known for drug activity. Officers in Southern California check in with a driver parked in a known drug hotbed.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Deputies pursue a man wanted in connection with a family violence call. Detectives are called to a dispute between neighbors over an unleashed dog. Officers stop a suspect and find paperwork containing dozens of others Social Security numbers.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S21 : E25 Hide and Go Porch
programme.desc: Officers engage in a car chase when they spot a possible robbery suspect. A man nicknamed “Danger” is tasered after assaulting several girls. Suspects bail from a vehicle and hide under a porch.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Suspects lead Officers on a reckless car chase on residential streets. Police tend to a woman assaulted by her inebriated friend. A DWI suspect is found relieving himself in a public port-a-potty.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: During a routine traffic stop, an Officer recognizes the passengers from a prior drug related arrest. A K-9 unit assists in the pursuit of a grand theft auto suspect who flees on foot. An arrest is made after a couple leaving a known drug house is pulled over and questioned.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A dispute inside a nightclub turns into a street fight. A man patrols his neighborhood ‘Old West’ style. A K-9 unit is called in to track a burglar on the run.

programme.title: Tom the Tow Truck
programme.desc: Poznaj Toma, wynalazcę z Samochodzikowa! W swoim nowoczesnym laboratorium tworzy wynalazki, aby rozwiązać problemy przyjaciół.

programme.title: Tom's Garage
programme.desc: Tom the Tow Truck pomaga swoim przyjaciołom z Car City, gdy ci potrzebują naprawy. Zawsze daje im coś specjalnego po każdej pracy.

programme.title: Tom's Paint Shop
programme.desc: Zatrzymaj się w warsztacie Toma Holownika! Ten kreatywny malarz z radością ulepszy i nada swoim przyjaciołom nowy, świeży wygląd.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob rewards the community kids for their hard work on the new park skateboard ramp. He "Kick Flips" the grill with some maple mustard pork burgers, chicken smoked pizza and corn on the cob with chili butter.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob's Road Warriors square off with Andy's Ass-phalt Assassins in a road hockey tournament. In the end, everybody wins though with Rob's post game feast of lamb kabobs, grilled carrot salad, corn on the cob, and chocolate chicken breasts.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob and his buddy Jim are planning a weeklong scuba diving trip. The problem is they don't know how to scuba dive. Rob entices a scuba dive instructor to give them a crash course in exchange for an ocean of fennel crusted tuna, shrimp and scallop stuffed veal, summer melon soup and some corn and wild rice pancakes.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Not only do the racers in the Soap Box Derby have a need for speed, they have a need for BBQ! Matt and the RG team cook up a feast to slow down any speedster. The menu: Smoked Shrimp B.L.T., Pineapple Basil Rotisserie Chicken, Grilled Sweet Potato Pops, and Summer Berry Pudding.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Day By the Water
programme.desc: Matt spends the day by the water; fishing, playing Frisbee, catching some rays. What goes with water and sun? BBQ!!! Matt & his team make a seafood buffet of Grilled Clams in the Shell with Serrano Ham, Smoked Lake Rainbow Trout, Grilled Lobster with Grapefruit Salsa, and Crab-Stuffed Avocados.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Matt gets down and dirty playing some beach Volleyball. In between bumps, sets, and spikes, the RG team serves up a smorgasbord of great food. The menu: Grilled Chicken Breast on Foccacia with Grilled Apples & Cambozola Cheese, Sezchuan Ribs with Chunky Plum Dipping Sauce, Roasted Corn and Pepper Potato Salad, and Homemade Protein Bars

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Forget bicycle built for two. This Big Bike fits 30 people! Matt & the team join forces with the Heart & Stroke foundation to raise money by riding around a track. Matt feeds these 'bikers' some healthy and delicious grub. The menu: Grilled Calamari, Smoked Turkey Fajitas, Grilled Scallops and Watermelon Salsa, and Cold Gazpacho.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: It's a bird, it's a plane, it's a day of great BBQ. Inspired by the aerial acrobatics of CF18's and Harvards, Matt cooks up a variety of poultry and fowl. The menu: Bacon Wrapped Quail Stuffed with 3 Cream Cheeses, Raspberry Chipotle Turkey Wings, Grilled Balsamic Marinated Duck Breast, and Deviled Eggs.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Whether you're a pro or a beginner, everyone is welcome to join the Road Grill team at the 19th tee where Matt is busy burnin' up his Q's. What better way to end your day at the links with an enticing menu of Miso Citrus Grilled Sablefish, Smoked Rack of Pork with a Sour Cherry Sauce , Lemon Basil Smashed Potatoes with Mushrooms, Arugula Salad with Peaches, and Blue Cheese and Walnuts.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: In between hoisting sails and scrubbing the deck, Matt and his team prepare a feast for the sailors before going on a long voyage. Not only is the weather perfect for sailing, it's perfect for BBQing! The menu: Scallop Corn Bacon Burger, Maple-apple Brined Pork Chops, Grilled Tuna Bruschetta, and Strawberry Marscapone Trifle.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Teddy Bears of all age, shape, and size join our grill team with their owners for a day of games, rides and some teddy bear repair. Matt & the RG team are BBQing a menu even the pickiest eater will love. The menu: Grilled Almond Butter & Banana Sandwiches, Grilled Meatball Sub, Smoked White Cheddar Macaroni, and Quick & Snappy Ginger Lemon Ice Cream Sandwiches.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Llamas, horses, and pigs...Oh My! The RG team lends it support to a farm animal rescue. Matt sets up his grills during a weekend fundraiser and stays friendly to his animal buddies by serving up a vegetarian menu. The menu: Portobello Burger Stack, Smoked Corn Tamale with Goat Cheese& Salsa Fresca, Pizza Salad Sandwich, and Tabbouleh Salad

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E10 Day at the Pool
programme.desc: The neighbourhood outdoor pool is a great way to cool down on a hot summer day. Matt and the Grill Team are dipping their feet in the pool, splashing with the kids, and, of course, grilling up some fabulous eats to munch on while playing in the park or relaxing on your towel. The menu: BBQ'd Pork Tenderloin & Pears on Bagels, Grilled Asian Chicken Burger, Surf & Turf Kabobs with Arugula Pesto, and BBQ'd Cinnamon Donuts.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: It's graduation day at Chef School and Matt and the Grill team are sharing in the festivities. To congratulate the new Chefs, Matt has cooked up a masterful menu of fancy, yet simple, dishes. The menu: Mixed Seafood Grill on a Plank, Maple Rosemary Rotisserie Chicken, Dunked Hunan Lamb Rack, and Salmon Pastrami.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: The Road Grill team goes rural and gets lost in hedge mazes at Saunders Farm. Luckily, they find their way out in time to cook up some BBQ and feed all families at the farm. The menu: Grilled Chicken Legs with Crunchy Chip Crust, Smoked Ham with Maple Mustard Glaze, Planked Asparagus Bundles with Cheese and Prosciutto, and Cobb Salad.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Honey, Cherries, Garlic Scapes and Carrots
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera transforms market fresh honey, cherries, garlic scapes and carrots into two simple chic sides and an irresistible dessert.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Sprouts, Veggies and Potatoes
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera creates two summer fresh salads and a hearty breakfast using sprouts, potatoes and leafy lambs quarters.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Kohlrabi, Fennel, Kale and Red Cabbage
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera shows us why fresh is always best with two creative dishes using ingredients from the farmers' market.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Raspberries, Mint, Peas and Apricot
programme.desc: Zestful cook Amanda Herrera scoops up raspberries, peas, mint, and apricots to use in three summer recipes.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Collard Greens, Maple Syrup, Goat Cheddar and Heirloom Cherry Tomatoes
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera prepares a frittata, rosemary skewer chicken and grilled bread salad with fresh ingredients from a local farmers' market.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Broccoli, Rainbow Chard and Herbs
programme.desc: Warm host Amanda Herrera picks up colourful produce and herbs at a farmers' market to make a delicious appetizer and tasty cold oil French fries.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Honeycomb, Shallots and Iceberg Lettuce
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera transforms fresh market ingredients into two irresistible dishes, including a one pot Lamb Curry with Honeycomb.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Patty Pan Summer Squash and Cabbage
programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera grills up two dinner recipes using patty pan summer squash and cabbage that she picked up from the market.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Beans, Raspberry Jam and Relish
programme.desc: On today's Fresh Market Dinners menu, host Amanda Herrera prepares succulent burgers with golden fries and a refreshing cocktail.

programme.title: Fresh Market Dinners
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Cream, Sunflower Oil and Cherry Tomatoes
programme.desc: Using cream, sunflower oil and cherry tomatoes from the market, host Amanda Herrera makes an irresistible pasta recipe and indulgent dessert.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Beef Episode with Chef Ned Bell
programme.desc: The perfect steak is a beautiful thing. Chef Ned Bell works with various cuts of beef and demonstrates the techniques used to create mouth-watering carnivorous dishes.

programme.title: MORE One Big Recipe
programme.desc: Re-join Chef Kimberly Lallouz in her One Big Recipe test kitchen as she masterfully creates a week night feast of Vietnamese style clams, braised greens, balsamic Cipollini onions, pork chops with grilled peaches, and avocado cake with avocado frosting.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Fun and quirky host Chef Spencer Watts kicks off this episode by showing off his knife skills as he sabres a pineapple to start his instant classic; Grilled Fruit Salad. The pineapple joins a mix of bright summer fruits on the grill, then berries, spicy citrus vinaigrette and savoury feta cheese. Next up, Spencer whips up his Hawaiian Chicken recipe. Spiced with cayenne and Chinese five spice, Spencer stuffs flavourful chicken thighs with pineapple and grills it with a delightful ginger and soy sauce. Every bite is sweet, savoury, and fresh - exactly how summer should taste! Then Spencer shares his top tips for adding smoky flavours to pork using an easy and handy smoke pouch. His Apple...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Allium in the Family
programme.desc: Onions, green onions, chives, garlic, and leeks are all members of the same fabulous flowering family, Allium! First up? Chef Watts shows us his sweet and smoky Charred Leeks with Romesco; add grilled toast and you have your next party appetizer! Next up is a main course. Spencer starts with a juicy grilled pork chop, then adds roasted garlic melted into a balsamic onion chutney to make his out-of-this-world Roasted Garlic Pork Chops. Looking for a crowd pleaser that's easy to make? Spencer has a recipe for that! Chicken Yakitori. He threads skewers with crunchy green onions and tender chicken and caramelizes the yakitori sauce as he grills this tasty dish. Are you ready to drool? Spencer...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Have a cheese lover coming over? Blow their minds with some of Spencer's "grate" barbecued cheese recipes! First up, Spencer chars Brie Cheese to an ooey-gooey perfection and tops it with tart cherries and crunchy walnuts, serving it with crispy grilled crostinis. Next up is a Grilled Steak and Caesar with a twist only Spencer could add - grilled... lettuce! Then, Spencer uses the classic German "hasselback" presentation to stuff chicken breasts with verdant spinach, yummy Swiss cheese and pungent sun- dried tomatoes, grilling them to melty perfection. Finally, Spencer fires up his barbecue to make his Grilled Peaches with Salted Bourbon Caramel, a decadent dessert elevated with creamy...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: In this bacon loving episode, Chef Spencer delivers a tasty Bacon Weave Turkey Breast, which gets injected with beer and spices before being wrapped up in its cozy bacon blanket and sent off to the grill! Next up? A Peameal Bacon Roast with Rosti. This heavy hunk of back bacon gets smoked to flavourful perfection while Chef Watts makes the crispiest golden-fried-to-perfection potato pancake. Then, Spencer whips up a charry, grilled, super decadent, bacon-wrapped and bacon stuffed cheeseburger. Spencer isn't finished with bacon yet! For his final recipe, Spencer stuffs an apple with decadent crispy morsels stuffed along with savoury caramelized onions and melty cheddar cheese.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: This episode kicks off with Spencer's tasty Grilled Caesar Salad. He skillfully piles of char-grilled romaine lettuce wedges and sourdough croutons are topped with tangy dressing, crispy pancetta, and shards of a homemade parmesan tuile. For his next recipe, Spencer whips up Grilled Zucchini Boats that filled with fresh ingredients including orzo pasta, summer veggies, and herbs. Chef Watts loves a good steak and his Grilled Cauliflower Steak is not one to be passed up! Dusted in Middle Eastern Spices, flame roasted and served with chili-spiked, Yemeni 'Skhug' hot sauce and pomegranate seeds. Finally, Spencer steams tender artichokes, stuffing these flowers with breadcrumbs and...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: The most liked post on any grill-master's social feed is 'meat on a stick' - and Chef Spencer's Turkish-style chicken kabob is worth every click! He marinates thick juicy chicken morsels in yogurt and spices, and then grills these flavourful skewers to a charry perfection. Next up is the creative 'Tornado Potato' which re- invents grilled potatoes with a wild presentation and a trio of toppings. Spencer then assembles Char Siu Sliders on tiny party- ready buns. Stuffed with a soy, honey and umami-packed hoisin lacquered slow-and-low grilled pork belly, these tasty little sliders will have your taste buds tingling. For his final recipe, Spencer whips up toasted crispy roti cups; topping...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Chef Spencer starts this spicy barbeque episode with flavours from Thailand with a Bok Choy with a Ginger Chili Sauce. Powerful bird's eye chilies are packed into a sweet and spicy sauce and served over tasty grilled bok choy. Spencer then introduces us to Calabrian chilies, mashed into a spice paste and rubbed on butterflied chicken that then gets grilled to flame-kissed perfection. Next, Spencer gives fresh calamari some heat with Korean chilies that add their distinctive heat and flavour before grilling this scrumptious recipe and serving it over a comforting bed of rice and peas. Finally, Spencer prepares Seekh Kabobs, made with ground lamb spiked with punchy dried Kashmiri chilies...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: First stop on Chef Spencer's Spanish flavour tour? Habanero Char-Grilled Octopus - warmed up with punchy chilies and balanced with a sweet and tangy sherry vinaigrette. Next, Spencer stuffs whole sea bass with citrus and herbs, gives it the grill treatment and then tops it with olive oil blistered cherry tomatoes. The rotisserie does the heavy lifting for Mr. Watts' whole roast chicken - spiked with bright Spanish flavours like Spanish chilies and smoked paprika, slow cooked and served extra juicy. Finally, Spencer prepares a classic Spanish recipe: Paella. Loaded saffron rice, piled high with chorizo, veggies, and shellfish. Of course, Spencer's Paella is made in the Spanish tradition;...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 The Butter Did It
programme.desc: It's all about beautiful butter in this episode of Watts on the Grill! First up, entertaining host Spencer fires tosses clams in velvety butter, zesty garlic and earthy spices to make his Clams with Garlic Paprika Butter. Next up is a traditional Indian recipe, but done on the grill - Butter Chicken! All the butter chicken flavours we love are infused in the marinade, before getting crisped up on the fiery grill - the result is both classic and completely new! Scallops are next, grilled and served with a mouth-watering caper-raisin butter. For his final recipe; Chef Watts prepares a rich and juicy grilled Rib Steak topped with a decadent port wine compound butter. Oh, what a butter-loving...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: We've all cooked with salt. But what about ON salt. That's right, chef Spencer Watts blows our minds with his seared scallops that are cooked on a Himalayan pink salt block. His next recipe uses a quick cure with Hawaiian black lava salt on swordfish steaks, then tops them with a gorgeous and refreshing grilled fruit salsa. Then, Spencer gets creative with Cured Duck Legs with Scallions, using a salt cure to intensify the flavours of duck leg before it's cooked slow and low, then glazed with maple and soy. After cooking on salt, curing with salt, the only thing left is to cook INSIDE salt - Spencer's Salt Crusted Prime Rib is a game changer, flavourful, bone-in beef that he seasons with a...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Chocolate on the barbecue? That's right. Chef Spencer Watts kicks off this episode as he grills a crispy coconut-cacao crust and serves it with sweet chili dipping sauce. Chocolate is the not-so-secret ingredient in Spencer's Grilled Chicken Molé. He grills the chicken legs smothered in the sweet-spicy-salty-nutty-creamy-chocolatey sauce, then finishes it by cooking it slow and low. Next, dark chocolate cocoa powder is in both the rub and the sauce for Chef Watts' favourite pork rib recipe - Cocoa-rubbed Baby Back Ribs. For his final recipe, Spencer takes it to a sweet level with his Chocolate pizza made with chocolate ganache, grilled cherries, with barbeque- caramelized white chocolate...

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E12 The Art of Wood
programme.desc: It's time to celebrate the art of smoking with wood! You'll drool over Spencer's Cherrywood Smoked Chicken Wings, dry rubbed with his favourite spices and smoked with cherrywood. Next, Spencer marinates sable fish in Japanese ingredients and grills it on a sweet-smoky cedar plank. Then, Spencer shows off his Texas BBQ skills with his Mesquite Smoked Skirt Steak. Engulfed in a thick cloud of white smoke, this skirt steak has the flavour and texture of tasty brisket, but made in a fraction amount of time. Finally, Spencer gives a pork shoulder a long, smoky cook in oak wood. The wait is worth it as he serves it piled high on a bun and topped with a mustardy Carolina BBQ sauce.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Looking sexy in his grass skirt, Rob and his fish monger friend Jim Foster hang up their surf boards and throw a great Hawaiian Luau. They prepare a feast including kaluah pork, cowabunga shrimp and some freshly grilled fennel and orange salad. It's a tropical feast.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob throws a hot Mardi Gras party with a Cajun Creole Menu. There's no parade, but there is great food, fabulous music and beads galore! Skillet Cornbread, Cajun catfish, and creole smoked ribs get this party going an keep it going all night long.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Men love beer. Men love fire. Men love to eat. Put it all together and you get a backyard full of men feasting off of a beer inspired barbecued meal including roasted chicken on a beer can, beer wings, beer burgers and even a beer dressing for potato salad.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob and his close friends are singing in an airband contest. To commemorate this occasion Rob prepares a feast of fabulous food including Proscuitto wrapped veal, grilled baby onions, asparagus rafts and parmesan crusted scallops.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob's friend has just accepted a job to teach English in Japan. As a sendoff Rob is preparing an Asian Feast on the grill - juicy slow rotisserie duck, seared fresh tuna and smoked asian veggies. It's a bon voyage dinner she certainly won't forget!

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob's favourite movie of all time is The Godfather. In a tribute to this great film he and his friends gather for an Italian feast off the grill before heading inside to watch the movie. Rob prepares a grilled vegetable pasta sauce, spicy Italian sausage, grilled veal chops and delicious calamari.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Caribbean Bon Voyage Fiesta
programme.desc: In honour of Rob's neighbors' grand prize win of all expenses paid cruise to the Caribbean, Rob prepares a Caribbean Feast. Smoked Pork loin in a passion fruit applesauce, jerk snapper and island salsa are all on his menu as the celebration begins in his backyard.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob is having a wine & cheese party with a bunch of his closest friends. From the lamb chops to the lobster tails - he combines the wine and cheese into every element of the delicious grilled menu

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: A charity aerobic marathon has everybody desperate for some great food so Rob prepares some delicious healthy dishes including chicken satay, a rotisserie veal roast, polenta kabobs, and ceasar shrimp.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: Rob's close friend is having a 40th birthday next week. He and some friends are throwing an "over the hill" party in honor of the "old man". They celebrate the occasion with a port marinated rack of lamb and chicken breasts, herbed barbecued mussels and some great sides.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.desc: A storm has knocked out the power all over the city and there is more rain to come. With no power, some great food from Rob's fridge will go to waste. He braves the storm and prepares an incredible grilled dinner including a grilled vegetable frittata, bacon wrapped chicken legs and a smoked veal loaf.

programme.title: License to Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E12 Poker Night With the Boys
programme.desc: Rob is having the boys over to play some cards. He's hoping a great meal of beef fajitas, flattened chili chicken and smoked baked beans will get them to lose their focus and belly up the cash at the table!

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Barbecuing bananas, that's crazy. Chef Spencer Watts shows us how to grill the delicate, evERS-scrumptious fruit. Bananas.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Fish on the Grill
programme.desc: Fish. Flaky, flavoursome, and perfect for barbeque. High energy host Spencer Watts tests out his grill with delightfully tender fish dishes.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Shellfish is delicate, tantalizing, and full of flavour, especially when it's grilled to perfection

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Barbeque is all about sauces, rubs and marinades

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Salsa that will Dance on Your Tongue
programme.desc: Salsa means undeniable flavour! Lively host Spencer Watts plays with sweet, salty, and spicy in four amazing salsa recipes.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Grilling expert Spencer Watts hosts a tasty beef-a-palooza with four incredible beef cuts including smoked brisket and succulent beef tenderloin.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Barbeque isn’t Just for Meat
programme.desc: Barbeque is not just about meat! Chef Spencer Watts shows us how to grill fruits and vegetables like a pro.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Grilled, Roasted & Charred Chicken
programme.desc: Charismatic host Spencer Watts shows us why chicken is best on the grill with four irresistible chicken recipes.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: There are limitless options with lamb on the grill! Host Spencer Watts offers some tips and tricks on how to prepare four different cuts of lamb.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.desc: Whether for a small family dinner or a big backyard barbeque, host Spencer Watts shows us the best ways to grill up tasty duck, turkey, capon, and quail.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Sides & Sweets with Heat
programme.desc: Never underestimate the power of a good side or dessert! Fun host Spencer Watts grills up the perfect sides and treats for your next barbeque.

programme.title: Watts On the Grill
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Pork was Made for Barbeques
programme.desc: Pork and the grill are good buddies and host Spencer Watts shows us four of his favourite pork recipes that will have you salivating.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Not only do the racers in the Soap Box Derby have a need for speed, they have a need for BBQ! Matt and the RG team cook up a feast to slow down any speedster. The menu: Smoked Shrimp B.L.T., Pineapple Basil Rotisserie Chicken, Grilled Sweet Potato Pops, and Summer Berry Pudding.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Day By the Water
programme.desc: Matt spends the day by the water; fishing, playing Frisbee, catching some rays. What goes with water and sun? BBQ!!! Matt & his team make a seafood buffet of Grilled Clams in the Shell with Serrano Ham, Smoked Lake Rainbow Trout, Grilled Lobster with Grapefruit Salsa, and Crab-Stuffed Avocados.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Matt gets down and dirty playing some beach Volleyball. In between bumps, sets, and spikes, the RG team serves up a smorgasbord of great food. The menu: Grilled Chicken Breast on Foccacia with Grilled Apples & Cambozola Cheese, Sezchuan Ribs with Chunky Plum Dipping Sauce, Roasted Corn and Pepper Potato Salad, and Homemade Protein Bars

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Forget bicycle built for two. This Big Bike fits 30 people! Matt & the team join forces with the Heart & Stroke foundation to raise money by riding around a track. Matt feeds these 'bikers' some healthy and delicious grub. The menu: Grilled Calamari, Smoked Turkey Fajitas, Grilled Scallops and Watermelon Salsa, and Cold Gazpacho.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: It's a bird, it's a plane, it's a day of great BBQ. Inspired by the aerial acrobatics of CF18's and Harvards, Matt cooks up a variety of poultry and fowl. The menu: Bacon Wrapped Quail Stuffed with 3 Cream Cheeses, Raspberry Chipotle Turkey Wings, Grilled Balsamic Marinated Duck Breast, and Deviled Eggs.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Whether you're a pro or a beginner, everyone is welcome to join the Road Grill team at the 19th tee where Matt is busy burnin' up his Q's. What better way to end your day at the links with an enticing menu of Miso Citrus Grilled Sablefish, Smoked Rack of Pork with a Sour Cherry Sauce , Lemon Basil Smashed Potatoes with Mushrooms, Arugula Salad with Peaches, and Blue Cheese and Walnuts.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: In between hoisting sails and scrubbing the deck, Matt and his team prepare a feast for the sailors before going on a long voyage. Not only is the weather perfect for sailing, it's perfect for BBQing! The menu: Scallop Corn Bacon Burger, Maple-apple Brined Pork Chops, Grilled Tuna Bruschetta, and Strawberry Marscapone Trifle.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Teddy Bears of all age, shape, and size join our grill team with their owners for a day of games, rides and some teddy bear repair. Matt & the RG team are BBQing a menu even the pickiest eater will love. The menu: Grilled Almond Butter & Banana Sandwiches, Grilled Meatball Sub, Smoked White Cheddar Macaroni, and Quick & Snappy Ginger Lemon Ice Cream Sandwiches.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: Llamas, horses, and pigs...Oh My! The RG team lends it support to a farm animal rescue. Matt sets up his grills during a weekend fundraiser and stays friendly to his animal buddies by serving up a vegetarian menu. The menu: Portobello Burger Stack, Smoked Corn Tamale with Goat Cheese& Salsa Fresca, Pizza Salad Sandwich, and Tabbouleh Salad

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.sub-title: S02 : E10 Day at the Pool
programme.desc: The neighbourhood outdoor pool is a great way to cool down on a hot summer day. Matt and the Grill Team are dipping their feet in the pool, splashing with the kids, and, of course, grilling up some fabulous eats to munch on while playing in the park or relaxing on your towel. The menu: BBQ'd Pork Tenderloin & Pears on Bagels, Grilled Asian Chicken Burger, Surf & Turf Kabobs with Arugula Pesto, and BBQ'd Cinnamon Donuts.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: It's graduation day at Chef School and Matt and the Grill team are sharing in the festivities. To congratulate the new Chefs, Matt has cooked up a masterful menu of fancy, yet simple, dishes. The menu: Mixed Seafood Grill on a Plank, Maple Rosemary Rotisserie Chicken, Dunked Hunan Lamb Rack, and Salmon Pastrami.

programme.title: Road Grill
programme.desc: The Road Grill team goes rural and gets lost in hedge mazes at Saunders Farm. Luckily, they find their way out in time to cook up some BBQ and feed all families at the farm. The menu: Grilled Chicken Legs with Crunchy Chip Crust, Smoked Ham with Maple Mustard Glaze, Planked Asparagus Bundles with Cheese and Prosciutto, and Cobb Salad.

programme.desc: Warm host Amanda Herrera picks up colourful produce and herbs at a farmers' market to make a delicious appetizer and tasty cold oil French fries.

programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera transforms fresh market ingredients into two irresistible dishes, including a one pot Lamb Curry with Honeycomb.

programme.desc: Host Amanda Herrera grills up two dinner recipes using patty pan summer squash and cabbage that she picked up from the market.

programme.desc: On today's Fresh Market Dinners menu, host Amanda Herrera prepares succulent burgers with golden fries and a refreshing cocktail.

programme.desc: Desiree Nielsen shows how salads can be a tasty main AND served warm with a grilled romaine salad.

programme.desc: Desiree Nielsen ditches regular butter for a fruit butter as she bakes a beautiful apple butter turnover with pecans and gorgonzola.

programme.title: The Urban Vegetarian
programme.desc: Desiree Nielsen adds more plants to her plate with two epic grilled cheese recipes that sneak in veggies.

programme.title: The Urban Vegetarian
programme.desc: Food nerd Desiree Nielsen knows how to add more veggies to our morning and shows us how it's done with a blueberry, celery, cucumber, and red cabbage juice.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Crispy, crunchy, salty, and sweet - Chef Spencer Watts prepares a Spring-inspired Thai feast in under 30 minutes, for around 30 dollars.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: In 30 minutes, chef Spencer Watts cooks up homey classics including a mouth-watering Chicken Stew and melt-in-your-mouth Herb Butter Biscuits.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Chef Spencer Watts cooks up an Italian feast for four including a cheesy Cannelloni and a fast and fluffy Tiramisu.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Night at the Pub
programme.desc: It's pub night in Spencer Watts' kitchen! Forget going out - Spencer's pub recipes are bold in flavour and mild on the wallet!

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.sub-title: S06 : E17 Chocolate Episode with Chef Katie Ardington
programme.desc: Masterful chef-host Katie Ardington loves chocolate, don't we all? Watch as she shares her chocolate handling knowledge and skill in this episode.

programme.desc: Kids don't always love fish - host Spencer Watts shares some simple, inexpensive, and tasty recipes that will change your kids' opinion of fish night.

programme.title: Cook Like a Chef
programme.sub-title: S05 : E12 Cakes and Icings with Chef Tim McRoberts
programme.desc: With ease and grace Chef Tim McRoberts bakes like a chef. Chef makes gorgeous chocolate molten cake, and demonstrates that art of working fondant.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Cheese or chocolate? Why not both! In this "C" challenge, host Theresa Visintin takes on both decadent ingredients. But first, she shows us that being cheesy is easy, especially when you stuff chicken breast with creamy goat's cheese and finely diced apples. Theresa takes the flavour one step further by coating the stuffed chicken with sage, parmesan, and panko bread crumbs, then frying it to a crispy golden brown. Next, Theresa whips up a dessert fan favourite, the decadent and oh-so-irresistible dark chocolate lava cake. Finally, Theresa has an irresistible recipe using ooey gooey cheese and warm chocolate.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Simplicity is key with Sicilian cuisine and Chef Michael Bonacini explores just how the region balances simplicity with intensity through four flavourful dishes. Starting with an antipasto of Folded Flatbread with Ricotta and Fennel Seeds, Michael inspires with its intricate beauty with a simple recipe. Keeping to the theme of simplicity, Michael shows that plenty of flavour can come from little ingredients in his primo of Broccoli and Sausage Rigatoni. The spicy sausage and chili is countered by a creamy broccoli pesto for a dish that highlights Sicilian cuisine. Michael turns to the Italian queen of crops for his secondo: Eggplant Parmesan Roll-Ups. With thin slices of eggplant rolled...

programme.title: Pressure's On
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Sweet, Salty, and Surprising Multi-Cooker Recipes
programme.desc: Using a multi-cooker, charming host Vanessa Gianfrancesco cooks up a four dishes that are salty, sweet, and surprising.

programme.title: Fish the Dish
programme.desc: Meaty prawns and melt-in-your-mouth cod are on the menu as trendy chef and seafood expert Spencer Watts gets a little "salty" with seafood.

programme.title: Fish the Dish
programme.desc: Chef Spencer Watts shows how the burst of acidity from lemon, lime, orange and grapefruit adds enticing flavor to mild mahi-mahi and sweet scallops.

programme.title: America's Most Delicious
programme.desc: Tacos are a worldwide sensation, and these taco recipes are definitely America's Most Delicious! Start ing with Carnitas, complete with pork shoulder confit, fried till crisp, and served with homemade guacamole. Next, fresh peaches add a sweet note to a traditional salsa served with a pulled pork taco. To end things on a lighter note, fish tacos are made with trout for a delicate, flavorful dish.

programme.title: America's Most Delicious
programme.desc: Feast on the most delicious brussels sprouts recipes out there! Indulge in a havarti cheese melt toasted with sautéed sprouts and shallots, tuck into the herby simplicity of grilled Brussels sprouts, or inhale a light and luscious blueberry-sprout salad.

programme.title: America's Most Delicious
programme.desc: Cupcakes are the perfect, bite-sized dessert, and these are the most delicious versions! First, an Asian-inspired muffin made with palm sugar and strong Vietnamese coffee. Then, a totally vegetarian chocolate cupcake with pink velvet frosting that's as yummy as can be! Finally, for showstopping presentation, check out a multicolored cupcake bouquet complete with flowers and leaves that you can eat.

programme.title: America's Most Delicious
programme.desc: Curry has gone from Indian staple to international favorite, and these are the most delicious recipes! First, a lamb curry uniquely garnished with crunchy pieces of honeycomb. Next, a classic chicken tikka masala, with tips and tricks courtesy of the expert host. Finally, a tropical-style lobster curry that leaves you wanting more.

programme.title: America's Most Delicious
programme.desc: Lasagna is quintessentially Italian, and these are the most delicious versions. First, check out simple, classic lasagna that anyone can make. Next, get wowed by one made in the style of Le Marche, a central Italian province with a unique food footprint. Finally, dig into a Latin-inspired lasagna made with plantain and halibut - not traditional, but totally delicious!

programme.title: America's Most Delicious
programme.desc: There are so many ways to enjoy Ribs as your search for that perfect sauce, rub, or marinade! Try out these delicious recipes and find your favourite! First, enjoy a classic take on a saucy rack of Barbecue Ribs. Next, a trip to Italy with an aromatic dish of Lime and Mint Pork Ribs. Finally, things get low and slow with a Braised Beef Short Rib recipe that is sure to be a crowd pleaser.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Renowned Chef Michael Bonacini takes viewers on a culinary tour of the Italian region of Trentino-Alto Adige without leaving his own kitchen.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Charming host Chef Michael Bonacini explores the mountainous region of Basilicata with a feast fit for any celebration. Beginning with an antipasto that caters to the region's southern heat, Michael stuffs crunchy sweet peppers with ripe tomatoes, savoury anchovies, and fresh oregano. Moving on to the primo, Michael cooks up a creamy Vermicelli Frittata. Using leftover pasta, he combines eggs with cheese, anchovies, and chili flakes for extra flavour to make a classic Basilicata dish. Michael cooks up Pollo Alla Potentina, a traditional meal from the Feast of Saint Gerard. This hearty chicken stew is sure to heat up your core, using hot peppers as the base of the meal. For his final dish,...

programme.title: Pressure's On
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Sweet, Salty, and Surprising Multi-Cooker Recipes
programme.desc: Using a multi-cooker, charming host Vanessa Gianfrancesco cooks up a four dishes that are salty, sweet, and surprising.

programme.title: Up the Dish
programme.desc: In this episode of Up the Dish, host Micah Trainor takes a stab at Cassoulet with buttery white beans, duck leg confit, and flavourful French sausage - and the result is mouth-wateringly good! The pressure's on, but Tiera Singh doesn't let up with her Chinese Long Bean Stir Fry. Succulent sausage, delicious duck breast, and flavorful vegetables come together for a truly sumptuous dish! For her vegetarian variant, Missy Hui must move things up a notch, but how? Agedashi Tofu! Breaded crispy semi-firm tofu is doused in a dashi, gochujang, and mirin mixture for the ultimate umami mouthful. Poppy Sandler goes above and beyond with her Chocolate-crusted Elk Loin, seared and drizzled with a...

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Emilia Romagna is the culinary heart of Italy and Chef Michael Bonacini shows viewers how to make some of the region's most delicious dishes.

programme.title: Spencer's Big 30
programme.desc: Kids don't always love fish - host Spencer Watts shares some simple, inexpensive, and tasty recipes that will change your kids' opinion of fish night.

programme.title: A is for Apple
programme.desc: Cheese or chocolate? Why not both! In this "C" challenge, host Theresa Visintin takes on both decadent ingredients. But first, she shows us that being cheesy is easy, especially when you stuff chicken breast with creamy goat's cheese and finely diced apples. Theresa takes the flavour one step further by coating the stuffed chicken with sage, parmesan, and panko bread crumbs, then frying it to a crispy golden brown. Next, Theresa whips up a dessert fan favourite, the decadent and oh-so-irresistible dark chocolate lava cake. Finally, Theresa has an irresistible recipe using ooey gooey cheese and warm chocolate.

programme.title: Bonacini's Italy
programme.desc: Simplicity is key with Sicilian cuisine and Chef Michael Bonacini explores just how the region balances simplicity with intensity through four flavourful dishes. Starting with an antipasto of Folded Flatbread with Ricotta and Fennel Seeds, Michael inspires with its intricate beauty with a simple recipe. Keeping to the theme of simplicity, Michael shows that plenty of flavour can come from little ingredients in his primo of Broccoli and Sausage Rigatoni. The spicy sausage and chili is countered by a creamy broccoli pesto for a dish that highlights Sicilian cuisine. Michael turns to the Italian queen of crops for his secondo: Eggplant Parmesan Roll-Ups. With thin slices of eggplant rolled...

programme.desc: Flåm is an idyllic town sitting in a spectacular setting at the head of Aurlandsfjorden. He also takes a cruise to see the stunning UNESCO-listed fjord, Nærøyfjord, and goes on to experience the cuisine and ways of life of the Vikings in Njardarheimr, a Viking village in nearby Gudvangen.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: In the heritage lanes of the mediterranean island, buried in the depths of time, are the archaeological sites of Cyprus. Be it Khirokitia, one of the most significant Neolithic settlements of Cyprus, Paphos, a mysterious city with Greek influences, or the vibrant splashes in the churches constructed during the Byzantine rule - Cyprus is rich in its heritage.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Boarding Pass Oslo, Norway
programme.desc: Oslo, the 1000-year-old Norwegian capital, is a compact and fun city that offers the perfect experience of contemporary cultural life in Norway. Here, Jamie Lowe visits iconic attractions such as the Nobel Peace Center, as well as more offbeat attractions such as the miniature bottle gallery and Frogner Park, which features 200 statues created by world-famous sculptor, Gustav Vigeland. He also tries the ski jump at nearby Holmenkollen.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Alex Outhwaite meets the descendants of the royal families of Hyderabad and Lucknow, and they tell her about the culture and cuisine of both kingdoms.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E23 Xp Guide Oslo 2, Norway
programme.desc: During Elisha’s visit to Oslo, she finds herself in awe of the extraordinary well-designed ships used by the legendary Vikings of Norway.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Boarding Pass Oslo, Norway

programme.title: Unwind

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Alexandra, in this episode visits Dubrovnik, where she explores a war museum, the dramatic monuments, mesmerising landscapes and tries water sports.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Boarding Pass North Cape, Norway
programme.desc: Famous journalist and explorer, Jamie Lowe visits the unofficial capital of the Northern Lights in Norway, Alta, where he encounters the two most exciting experiences the place has to offer: he witnesses the Aurora Borealis and he visits the UNESCO-listed Alta Museum with its rock carvings dating back to 7000 years ago. To get the full winter experience, he also tries reindeer sledding, spends a night at Sorrisniva ice hotel, and visits North Cape, the northernmost point of Europe.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: On a journey to find the lost and forgotten recipes of India, Alex finds herself at Asia’s biggest spice market.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Larnaca in Cyprus is one of the world’s 20 most ancient, continuously inhabited cities for the last 4000 years. Travel enthusiast, Sabrina sets out to find out more about the city but is waylaid when she finds a flock of flamingos at a lake side.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Boarding Pass North Cape, Norway

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E18 City Breaks Frankfurt, Germany
programme.desc: Frankfurt is the financial capital of the European Union. Kristina discovers that the city has much more to offer than just a good business meeting, as she learns about its history and architecture through its famous sights such as the Kaizerdom Cathedral and the Eltz Castle. She also goes to Rudesheim, where she encounters an amazing collection of data operated music instruments.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Backpack, Brac and Split Croatia
programme.desc: Stay tuned with Alex to find out what Barc, the coastal town of Croatia, has to offer a backpacker. She tries quad biking.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Boarding Pass Tromso, Norway
programme.desc: Jamie Lowe visits Tromsø, the gateway to the Arctic, where he gets to know the Arctic ways of life. He enjoys a reindeer burger, tries his hand at ice fishing, and gets a taste of the culture and cuisine of the Sami, the original inhabitants of the Arctic. He also goes to Bodø, where he witnesses one of the intense whirlpools created by Saltstraumen, one of the fastest tidal currents in the world.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: From a rich lamb curry to a hearty pulao made with rare mushrooms, Alex learns to make the secret recipes of a local family in Delhi.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus

programme.title: Boarding Pass

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 City Breaks Brussels, Belgium
programme.desc: Six hundred years ago, Brussels was just a nice place to stop and buy a waffle on the way to France. Exploring the capital of Belgium today, Catriona realizes that it’s a city where the historic Grand Palace and a hip museum of the world’s oldest and latest cars co-exist. It’s the city where the quirkiness of Mannekin-Pis meets the futuristic approach seen in the Atomium. It’s the city where traditional Belgian chocolates can be savored after a visit to the multicultural Mini Europe park.

He also tries husky sledding.

programme.desc: As Milagros delves deeper into the heart of the Amazonas, her journey takes a thrilling turn. In search of rare birds, she embarks on a boat ride at dawn. As the day progresses, she meets an indigenous tribe and unlocks ancient hunting secrets with them.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Alex Outhwaite meets the descendants of the royal families of Hyderabad and Lucknow, and they tell her about the culture and cuisine of both kingdoms.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: In the heritage lanes of the mediterranean island, buried in the depths of time, are the archaeological sites of Cyprus. Be it Khirokitia, one of the most significant Neolithic settlements of Cyprus, Paphos, a mysterious city with Greek influences, or the vibrant splashes in the churches constructed during the Byzantine rule - Cyprus is rich in its heritage.

programme.title: Unwind
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Unwind Banyan Tree, Maldives
programme.desc: Indeya unwinds at the Banyan Tree resort. She tries water sports, learns a traditional Maldivian recipe, rejuvenates herself at a spa and ends her day by exploring the capital city of Male.

programme.title: Xp Guide
programme.sub-title: S01 : E23 Xp Guide Oslo 2, Norway
programme.desc: During Elisha’s visit to Oslo, she finds herself in awe of the extraordinary well-designed ships used by the legendary Vikings of Norway.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Boarding Pass Oslo, Norway
programme.desc: Oslo, the 1000-year-old Norwegian capital, is a compact and fun city that offers the perfect experience of contemporary cultural life in Norway. Here, Jamie Lowe visits iconic attractions such as the Nobel Peace Center, as well as more offbeat attractions such as the miniature bottle gallery and Frogner Park, which features 200 statues created by world-famous sculptor, Gustav Vigeland. He also tries the ski jump at nearby Holmenkollen.

programme.title: Viajar Peru
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Viajar Peru Ica Nazca
programme.desc: Milagros’s first stop to showcase her country is at Ica on Peru’s southern coast known for its vineyards and for the desert oasis, Huacachina.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: On a journey to find the lost and forgotten recipes of India, Alex finds herself at Asia’s biggest spice market.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Alexandra, in this episode visits Dubrovnik, where she explores a war museum, the dramatic monuments, mesmerising landscapes and tries water sports.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E18 City Breaks Frankfurt, Germany
programme.desc: Frankfurt is the financial capital of the European Union. Kristina discovers that the city has much more to offer than just a good business meeting, as she learns about its history and architecture through its famous sights such as the Kaizerdom Cathedral and the Eltz Castle. She also goes to Rudesheim, where she encounters an amazing collection of data operated music instruments.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Larnaca in Cyprus is one of the world’s 20 most ancient, continuously inhabited cities for the last 4000 years. Travel enthusiast, Sabrina sets out to find out more about the city but is waylaid when she finds a flock of flamingos at a lake side.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Boarding Pass North Cape, Norway
programme.desc: Famous journalist and explorer, Jamie Lowe visits the unofficial capital of the Northern Lights in Norway, Alta, where he encounters the two most exciting experiences the place has to offer: he witnesses the Aurora Borealis and he visits the UNESCO-listed Alta Museum with its rock carvings dating back to 7000 years ago. To get the full winter experience, he also tries reindeer sledding, spends a night at Sorrisniva ice hotel, and visits North Cape, the northernmost point of Europe.

programme.title: Viajar Peru
programme.desc: In Arequipa, Milagros has set out to peel back the layers of her country’s history.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: From a rich lamb curry to a hearty pulao made with rare mushrooms, Alex learns to make the secret recipes of a local family in Delhi.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Backpack, Brac and Split Croatia
programme.desc: Stay tuned with Alex to find out what Barc, the coastal town of Croatia, has to offer a backpacker. She tries quad biking.

programme.title: City Breaks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 City Breaks Brussels, Belgium
programme.desc: Six hundred years ago, Brussels was just a nice place to stop and buy a waffle on the way to France. Exploring the capital of Belgium today, Catriona realizes that it’s a city where the historic Grand Palace and a hip museum of the world’s oldest and latest cars co-exist. It’s the city where the quirkiness of Mannekin-Pis meets the futuristic approach seen in the Atomium. It’s the city where traditional Belgian chocolates can be savored after a visit to the multicultural Mini Europe park.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Nicosia, the capital of the Republic of Cyprus is also its cultural heartbeat. Sabrina realizes this, as she sets out to unravel the stories of the largest city in Cyprus while being treated to a bath in a Hammam, which was formerly a church.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Boarding Pass Tromso, Norway
programme.desc: Jamie Lowe visits Tromsø, the gateway to the Arctic, where he gets to know the Arctic ways of life. He enjoys a reindeer burger, tries his hand at ice fishing, and gets a taste of the culture and cuisine of the Sami, the original inhabitants of the Arctic. He also goes to Bodø, where he witnesses one of the intense whirlpools created by Saltstraumen, one of the fastest tidal currents in the world.

programme.title: Viajar Peru
programme.desc: Amidst the sapphire expanse of Lake Titicaca, Milagros embarks on a journey of reconnecting with her roots. Delving into the secrets of the Uros, she unveils their timeless artistry in building floating islands, a testament to human resilience. But as she travels to Amantani Island, an enigma awaits—a forgotten temple, rituals that date back to the pre-Incan times, chapters of Peru’s lesser-explored history waiting to unfold.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: From papad ka paratha to lehsun ki kheer, Chef Aditya Jaimini shows Alex Outhwaite how to make some of the unusual dishes from Indian cuisine.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Backpack Split and Salona, Croatia
programme.desc: Explore the beautiful Dalmatian coast with a little history of Split with Alex and stay tuned as next she explores the port city of Salona.

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Great World Hotels Closenberg, Sri Lanka
programme.desc: Great World Hotels Closenberg, Sri Lanka

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: In the Troodos ranges of Cyprus, Sabrina Chakici visits the Kykkos Monastery and the ten small village churches, which have become a UNESCO World Heritage Site. She further ventures out to explore the Neolithic village of Khirokitia and learn about the age-old lace tradition in Lefkara village.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Boarding Pass Polar Park, Norway
programme.desc: The world’s northernmost animal park, the Polar Park in Bardu, nearby Tromsø, is home to many of Norway’s predators, and Jamie Lowe sees a few of them such as the lynx and the bear, but the most exciting experience he has is getting up, close and personal with wolves at the park. He also tries husky sledding.

programme.title: Viajar Peru
programme.desc: Milagros visits the ancient city of Cusco just in time for the legendary Inti Raymi Festival, a gateway to the Inca empire's beliefs. Hidden in the vibrant festivities, which continue into the night, are glimpses into the lives led by the people during the Inca era.

programme.title: Quest
programme.desc: Amritsar,where recipes have been passed down generations. Alex explores it in Quest.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.desc: Watch a musical instrument powered by sea waves and learn how glassware was made in Roman era. This and more with Alexandra in Zadar episode

programme.title: Great World Hotels
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Great World Hotels Le Telfair Heritage, Mauritius
programme.desc: An invigorating body massage, fresh seafood with rum, kayaking - Freishia enjoys finding out the ways in which Mauritius pampers its visitors.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.desc: Lying next to the island's beautiful Mediterranean coastline, in south-western Cyprus, the popular town of Paphos is home to some spectacular archaeological attractions and a rich Cypriot history. Here, Sabrina discovers the myths of the Greek and Roman philosophies, unravels the stories hidden in time at Paphos Archaeological Park, and explores the historic towns of Limassol and Kourion.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Boarding Pass Bronnoysund, Norway
programme.desc: The small coastal settlement of Brønnøysund is flanked on one side by an archipelago of islets and on the other by rolling farm country, and Jamie Lowe experiences the best of both worlds during his visit. He goes hiking in Trollfjel Geopark, visits a sea cave and learns about the folklore surrounding the Troll mountains. He also visits a local farmhouse to learn about life in the Norwegian countryside, and goes on to try cod fishing.

programme.title: 10 Days Cyprus
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 10 Days Cyprus Akamas National Park
programme.desc: From being the primary mode of transport for many centuries to helping in the production of olive oil, the donkeys in Cyprus have truly earned the status of the national animal. Our host, Sabrina Chakici finds out more about them and their significance to the country when she visits a donkey farm. She also visits Akamas Peninsula National Park, one of the island country’s last remaining wildernesses.

programme.title: Backpack
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Backpack, Plitvice Lopar and Zagreb Croatia
programme.desc: Alexandra in this episode explores Plitvice, where she visits a national park, interacts with locals, tastes local wine and then leaves for Zagreb.

programme.title: Viajar Peru
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Viajar Peru Inca Valley & Machu Picchu
programme.desc: Scaling rocks and defying heights, Milagros finds herself suspended 1200 feet above the ground at the Sacred Valley of the Incas.

programme.title: Boarding Pass
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Boarding Pass Roros, Norway
programme.desc: Røros, a historical Norwegian copper mining town full of impeccable wooden buildings, is a place that makes you travel back in time. Jamie Lowe strolls around the quaint town and checks out the mining museum to learn about the town’s fascinating history. Following this, he goes through Lærdal Tunnel, the world’s longest road tunnel, on his way to Flåm. Upon reaching, he goes to the Flåm Railway Museum, where he gets to know the exciting stories behind building the world's steepest railway.

programme.title: World Heritage
programme.desc: From the impact of maritime trade and the European Renaissance on Portugal in the 15th century to the nationwide Romanticism movement in the 19th century, the heritage sites of Portugal such as Jeronimo Monastery and Pena Palace reveal various stages of the country’s evolution.

programme.title: Red Bull Stalen Ros 2024 Highlights
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Red Bull Stalen Ros 2024 Highlights
programme.desc: Two people. Two wheels. One brake and a handlebar: that's all teams need for Red Bull Stalen Ros! See who conquers the most fun race on water, and who ends up soaked.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: S09 : E03 Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Red Bull Soapbox Race hits Kaunas, Lithuania! Watch teams race their funny, motorless cars and have the time of their lives. Don’t miss the fun and laughs in this exciting event!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: S09 : E04 Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Red Bull Soapbox Race is back in Dallas, Texas! Watch brave teams race their homemade soapbox cars down a wild and funny course. Don’t miss the thrills and laughs in this exciting event!

programme.title: Red Bull Flugtag
programme.desc: Teams create homemade flying machines inspired by local food, festivals, and traditions. Watch as they bring these fun, unique designs to life!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: S09 : E02 Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The wildest race on wheels hits Finland! Teams race homemade soapbox cars in Red Bull Soapbox Race 2019. Fast, fun, and full of action. Watch it all unfold!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The 2022 Red Bull Soapbox Race in Melbourne, Australia brings wild homemade racers, crashes, laughs, and fierce competition as teams race for the win in this high-speed, creative showdown.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The Red Bull Soapbox Race 2023 in Jordan challenges creative teams and their handmade cars on a wild track in Amman’s hills. With twists, turns and crashes, it’s a colourful race full of fun!

programme.title: Red Bull Flugtag
programme.desc: Teams build crazy homemade flying machines, from Tim Burton-inspired saucers to exploding volcanoes, all trying to stay in the air over Victoria Harbour in Hong Kong. Who will stay flying the longest?

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: S10 : E01 Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The judges are waiting to see incredible creativity and speed as racers race their homemade soapbox cars in Iowa, USA. Don’t miss the action!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: S10 : E02 Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The funny race with no engines and lots of obstacles. Have the teams built their homemade soapboxes well enough to reach the finish line, or will the course stop them?

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Fearless teams race through tough obstacles in their engineless machines at the Red Bull Soapbox Race 2022 in Spa, Belgium. Don’t miss the excitement!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Who will win in today’s gravity-powered race? The answer lies in Toulouse! May the pink city inspire strength and courage in all the brave participants. Don't miss the action!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: A churro-powered race heats up the steep roads of Madrid! Who will take the win, and who will crash into haystacks while the crowd cheers? Don’t miss the action!

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.sub-title: S09 : E01 Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The wildest race on wheels hits Brazil! Brave teams race homemade cars on a tough track. Fast, fun, and full of surprises—watch it all unfold!

programme.title: For Reals
programme.desc: Red Bull athletes wakeskate off a Dubai skyscraper, race on Florida’s waters and Nevada’s deserts, and ride a skatepark on a hot air balloon. This is just a normal day for them! Don’t miss the action!

programme.title: Beyond the ROX
programme.desc: HYROX athletes grind during the off-season, balancing their personal lives with the strength, endurance, and focus needed to compete with the elite. Watch as they push to be ready for the challenge!

programme.title: Beyond the ROX
programme.desc: Sadiq Elfitouri explains the switch from football to HYROX, and OCR World Champion Ida Mathilde makes an exciting debut, as the rapidly growing sport attracts top athletes from all sports.

programme.title: For Reals
programme.desc: Breaking world records is just another day for Red Bull athletes! Watch Felix Baumgartner jump from space, 65 women skydive together, and a BMX rider conquer the world’s biggest loop!

programme.title: Unrideable
programme.desc: Red Bull Erzbergrodeo pushes riders to the limit. Can champion Lettenbichler hold off rising star Brightmore in 2024? The race is tough, the stakes are high. Watch it all unfold!

programme.title: Unrideable
programme.desc: Wade Young fights to prove himself in the 2024 Xross Rally and Red Bull Romaniacs after losing his spot to Teodor Kabakchiev.

programme.title: For Reals
programme.desc: Red Bull athletes tour a town on a snowmobile, freerun through an airport, skateboard out of a flying plane, and ice climb Niagara Falls. It’s all part of their daring day! Don’t miss the adventure!

programme.desc: The exciting urban downhill mountain bike race is back for its third year in Guanajuato, Mexico! Watch as riders race through historic streets, some over 400 years old, in this thrilling event.

programme.title: Extended Race Highlights | 2025 Meguiar's Bathurst 12 Hour
programme.desc: Catch all the highlights from an exhilarating 2025 Meguiar's Bathurst 12 Hour which brought Mount Panorama to the global stage once again. The Bathurst 12 Hour, currently known as the Repco Bathurst 12 Hour, is an endurance race for GT and production cars held at the Mount Panorama Circuit, in Bathurst, Australia.

programme.title: The 10 Best British F1 Drivers Of All Time
programme.desc: With the 70th Anniversary Grand Prix taking place at Silverstone this weekend, we thought we’d take a look at some of the greatest F1 drivers to ever come out of Great Britain.

programme.title: How the FIA Robbed Hamilton's 2008 Belgian GP Win
programme.desc: After an intense battle with Kimi Raikkonen, Lewis Hamilton put on an incredible performance to cross the finish line first at the 2008 Belgian Grand Prix. But he never won... In the latest of Autosport’s “Short View Back to the Past” series, Chief Editor Kevin Turner looks at when Hamilton was robbed at Spa.

programme.title: Top 10 Senna Moments
programme.desc: Qualifying performances from "another dimension"; thrashing his rivals repeatedly in torrential wet conditions; doing whatever it took to win the world championship at all costs. Ayrton Senna's too-brief time in Formula 1 was a colourful tapestry of brilliant driving and high-stakes controversy. On the 25th anniversary of his tragic crash at Imola, Autosport brings you the most unforgettable moments of the late Brazilian's F1 career.

programme.title: WSBK - Round 6: Misano RELIVE
programme.desc: Take a look at all of the highlights from Round 6 of the 2025 WorldSBK championship at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli.

programme.desc: Catch up on all the highlights from the 2024 Spa Classic.

programme.title: Round 1: Rosario - Race 2
programme.desc: Watch the second race of the first round of the 2025 TCR South America season in Rosario, Argentina.

programme.title: BRC 2025 - Round 2: Rallye des Ardennes
programme.desc: With 60 participants on the entry list, the 71st Rallye des Ardennes is doing a lot better than the previous edition. The names of the top favorites have remained the same. Jos Verstappen, who won the race last year, is again being challenged by Bastien Rouard, who was the leader last year until he had to give up with two flat tires.

programme.title: Giorgio Piola: Illustrating Speed
programme.desc: For nearly 50 years Giorgio Piola has been the foremost technical journalist in Formula 1. He has attended more Grands Prix than anyone in history. This film looks at the remarkable career of this legend.

programme.title: The Top 10 Red Bull F1 Drivers - Part 1
programme.desc: Red Bull is much younger than Formula 1’s other big teams, having arrived in 2005. But in less than two decades it has racked up some impressive achievements. Six drivers’ and five constructors’ titles headline a CV that includes 92 world championship grand prix wins, enough for sixth on the all-time list behind Ferrari, McLaren, Mercedes, Williams and Lotus. For this list of top 10 F1 drivers, we’ve taken into account the amount of success the racers scored with Red Bull and its sister team Toro Rosso/AlphaTauri, the impact they had and the circumstances of their time within the Red Bull fold. Want to know more about our top 10 or hear experts debate the list? Take a look here: ...
